introduction.para: The following document provides guidelines for the operation test of a bicycle.

requiredSupportEquipment.para: The following support equipment is required:

requiredSupplies.para: No supplies are required for this procedure.

requiredSpares.para: No spares are required for this procedure.

requiredSafetyEquipment.para: No safety equipment is required for this procedure.

checkListProcedure.para: The following steps must be performed to complete the operation test:

item.title: Check Condition of Bike
item.para: Before every ride, check the condition of the bike.

item.title: Check Fasteners
item.para: Check all fasteners on the bike.

conditionalStatement.condition: If no fasteners are loose, proceed to the next step.
conditionalStatement.action: If any fasteners are loose, tighten them according to the specific maintenance instruction for the related component.

item.title: Lift Front Wheel and Spin
item.para: Lift the front wheel off the ground 2-3 inches and let it bounce on the ground.

conditionalStatement.condition: If nothing rattles or appears to be loose, proceed to the next step.
conditionalStatement.action: If the bike rattles or parts appear to be loose, secure the loose part according to the specific maintenance instruction for the related part.

item.title: Check Tire Pressure
item.para: Check the tire pressure against the specification printed on the side of the tire.

conditionalStatement.condition: If the tire pressure is correct, proceed to the next step.

action.para: If the tire pressure is not within the specification:

conditionalStatement.condition: If the pressure is high, bleed air from the tire until it reaches the maximum pressure printed on the side of the tire.
conditionalStatement.action: If the pressure is low, add air to the tire not to exceed the maximum pressure printed on the side of the tire.

item.title: Inspect Tire for Cuts or Cracks
item.para: Inspect the tire for cuts or cracks.

conditionalStatement.condition: If no damage is found, proceed to the next step.
conditionalStatement.action: If visible damage is found, replace the tire before riding.

item.title: Check Wheels for Trueness
item.para: Ensure wheels are true spinning, without wobble.

conditionalStatement.condition: If wheels do not wobble when spinning, proceed to the next step.
conditionalStatement.action: If wheels wobble when spinning, have the bike serviced and have the wheels made true.

item.title: Inspect Tire Rims for Wear
item.para: Inspect tire rims for wear indicator marks.

conditionalStatement.condition: If no wear indicator marks are visible, proceed to the next step.
conditionalStatement.action: If wear indicator marks are visible, replace the wheel.

item.title: Check Brakes
item.para: Squeeze the brake levers and check that front and back brakes securely grip the wheel rim.

conditionalStatement.condition: If brakes engage within 1 inch of brake lever movement, proceed to the next step.
conditionalStatement.action: If brakes do not engage within 1 inch of brake lever movement, tighten brakes according to maintenance procedure.

conclusion.para: The operation test is complete when all steps have been performed and any necessary repairs or adjustments have been made.
